page.title: 11DERING WINDOWS
page.content: Many of the older buildings in and around Pluckley have unusual arch-shaped windows. This dates from the time of the Civil War 1642-1652. Sir Edward Dering,the Lord of the Manor,did not agree with either the Royalist or the Parliamentarians. He was arrested by thr Roundheads but managed to escape and returned to Pluckley. His Manor house was searched by the Roundheads and he escaped through a small arched window which his pursuers considered too small to guard. Since then the Dering family have thought this window had a sacred charm and during the nineteenth century an eccentric descendant, Sir Edward Cholmeley Dering had arched windows fitted into all buildings on the estate.
